title: Has political correctness created a society where the wrong things have become right, and the right things have become wrong? - Quora

response.answer_text: (1) Thanks for the A2A. (2) Short answer: NoIrrelevant.There is a deeper malaise.Understand the roots of Political Correctness.In the beginning, there was discrimination, say, racial discrimination.Discrimination was primarily in 2 forms.Institutionalized e.g. discriminatory laws such as the US Jim Crow laws.Day-to-day soft interactional, transactional discrimination.Then, society moved forward some. Institutionalized discrimination which is very visible, objective and transparent in the form of discriminatory laws were taken down over time.But, racism is softwired in minds. It doesn’t go away just because bad laws are eliminated. The take down of institutionalized discriminatory laws emboldened racists. There is now legally, officially no racism. They ratcheted up on hard-to-detect soft racism. There are all kinds of societal problems, economic, social, poverty, inequality, injustice, etc, but there are no racism problems because there is no institutionalized racism. Pressing issues pertinent to specific minorities such as African-Americans are glossed over as broad societal problems. “Black Lives Matter”. Oh well, but don’t “All Lives Matter” too?Over time, the discriminated swathes of people find that they are no better off. Racism has taken cover under other realms. African-Americans have grave challenges getting bank loans to start businesses. ”Oh but, these are financial markets commercial issues, nothing to do with race.”To solve a problem, you have to define the “Problem Statement”. In the above situation, discrimination no longer exists legally, the problems defy definition. What exactly is the problem? No Problem Statement, so, no problem.Political Correctness is the frustrated response, the reaction, the outlet, to the above simmering issues. In these emotional reactions, we cannot expect very rational constructs. But, the cry of underlying frustration is real.Whether a particular Politically Correct “wrong” item should be deemed “right”, or vice versa, is a mere inconvenient symptom of a deeper malaise.Political Correctness will not go away anytime soon, because the above mentioned issues are trending towards worsening. E.g. the lot of African-Americans are worsening as we speak.

Has political correctness created a society where the wrong things have become right, and the right things have become wrong? “Political correctness”, otherwise known as “being a decent human being”, is slowly creating a society where people are being held to account for what they say. Where speech originally designed to denigrate “the other” (but which has largely been bastardised) is challenged, and we are being made to rethink the words we use. As for your actual question…where the wrong things have become right and the right have become wrong. I’m unsure what your meaning is here, it’s open for interpretation. Do you think you should be able to use sexist language and go unchallenged? Or do you think that, if you were to use sexist language, you should quite rightly be challenged? Honestly you can interpret this question either way, so clarification would be good.

If I ran into trouble, would they stick their neck out to help me, or would they run away? Would they be open to give and take, in terms of life’s practical necessities, but also in intellectual conversation? In other words, is this person deeply real. Do they have a personality that they have taken time to develop? Do they have character that isn’t just a pose, but has some substance to it? I always ask myself that.
